content: This app is great for the area it is intended to serve. (The Cottonwoods and surrounding drainages.) I have not had issues with the navigation dot and I use it often while out on tours to confirm location. Accurate in the field and that's all I'm asking it for. Works with the phone in airplane mode as well.
it's nice to have access to runs and names. Fixed landscape issue. Great, useful app
replyContent: It would have been helpful if you contacted regarding the landscape mode rather than leaving a review on the Play Store. We have an instant fix for this (it is caused by an Android Setting). Version 4.0.0 corrects this automatically.

content: Limited. This app is for a very specific area, and pricey for such a small area. When I tried to use this near Ogden, looking at the Wasatch Mountains, it tells me my location is off map. It does work in portrait, which was mentioned as a problem in other reviews, and the maps are blurry unless zoomed in. Cover the Wasatch front and use a zoom friendly map and this may be good.
best backcountry skiing app for the wasatch.

Disappointing, only works in landscape. Search function doesn't work at all. If you're not zoomed all the way down it's blurry. Even the compass doesn't work. Extremely dissatisfied with this, don't recommend anyone purchase this until it's fixed.
replyContent: It would have been helpful if you contacted us rather than leaving a review on the Play Store. We have an instant fix for this (it is caused by an Android Setting). Version 4.0.0 corrects this automatically.

content: The app on iPhone is awesome but the Android version suuuuucks. The map resolution is terrible unless it is entirely zoomed in. Fix this and the app will be great!
replyContent: Yeah, the Android version has always lagged the iPhone version. Version 4.0.0 fixed the blurry-map issue for many (but not all) users. Let me know if it fixed by sending a note to info@iterum.com. Thanks! Steve.

content: Was amazing on apple. Android version suuuuucks. I'd gladly give uac and other Wasatch supporters all my money if I could, but this app ain't the reason. My major problem is the resolution. It's terrible except when almost entirely zoomed in. Also it lags to load the map when adjusted, which makes no sense because you'd think it's sold offline. Sooo...
replyContent: Yeah, the Android version has always lagged the iPhone version. Version 4.0.0 fixed the blurry-map issue for many (but not all) users. Let me know if it fixed by sending a note to info@iterum.com. Thanks! Steve.

content: Good map. I did have to manually give the app permissions. Would be cool if you could pin and save locations. Or I haven't figured out how to save them.
replyContent: Thanks, Casey. Some newer Android devices require you to enable location permissions--glad you figured it out! I've decided, rightly or wrongly, to not save locations, tracks, etc. However, you can drop a pin at any location by tapping and holding (e.g., to email or navigate to that point). There are several good GPS-like apps (e.g., MotionX GPS).

content: Amazing app! Best BC ski app around. Unfortunately I must provide the feedback that the app is not working for location. The recent update for Android has rendered it nearly useless for any sort of gps antenna navigation. I spoke with Google about it and they recommended getting in touch with the developer. Google says they informed developers about most recent changes to Android OS. Thanks
replyContent: Unfortunately, we can't contact you when you leave a review. You can contact us using the Developer contact information listed on the Google Play store. You can also find our contact information and GPS troubleshooting tips on the Support tab at WBSkiing do com. Thanks!

content: It doesn't ask you automatically to allow location permissions. You have to manually go in and allow them. Otherwise it will just sit there and spin it's wheels which could be confusing. It's a good map.

Great to be in backcountry and verify where you are and the best approach. Worth every penny. Reviews that complain about not being able to find GPS need to read developers trouble shooting info. It's a setting toggle on your phone.
The search function is a joke
It's a map on your phone and spots you on GPS for easy trail finding

If you have an Android, stick with the paper map. On my Samsung Galaxy S4 this app had terrible resolution unless zoomed all the way in, long loading times, and would constantly reorient if you moved close to the edges. These flaws severely disrupted basic functions. I was looking forward to using this app, but will stay away until it is redesigned for Android.

Used a few times in the back county. Recently let me down big time when the app failed to load the map while I was on white pine. I wish I had used the money to buy the real map since this app is unreliable. Don't count on it when you need it.  I had to use Google maps to find my location.  In this app, the compass still worked but the map was blank. What a let down when I needed it to work.  And there is no technical support link from the app for bug reporting. Nice

Great supplement to the analog version and so much fun in the backcountry! Overall pretty good app, maps load slow when scrolling and zooming. Hopefully support will continue for things like satellite image data and route tracking/waypoints.
